Use Case: Data Ingestion. The Port of Entry to receive raw data feeds from vendors (Deep Sync, Placer.ai) before syncing to the app.
Strategic Review / Build Plan (My Notes): Keep this ONLY as the 'Data Port' to receive vendor feeds (Deep Sync/Placer). Do not let the app query this directlyit’s too slow and expensive. We need to sync clean data into our own Postgres DB for the actual product.

Use Case: Algorithm Computation. The backend environment where Data Scientists write and run the Smart Match algorithms that calculate the fit between a Tenant's criteria and a Property's location.
Strategic Review / Build Plan (My Notes): This is overkill. We don't need a massive Spark cluster just to match Tenants to Properties. Let's have the dev team write a standard Python + PostGIS script to run these matches. We should own the matching algorithm code, not rent it.

Use Case: Internal Prototyping. Used by the Data Team to visualize market trends (Vacancy/Absorption) for quality control before the Engineering team builds the actual charts into the customer dashboard.
Strategic Review / Build Plan (My Notes): Fine for the data team to play with, but do not build product features on this. If we need internal dashboards, let's spin up Streamlit (Python) apps. They are free and we can customize them infinitely.

Use Case: Research Operations. This is just an internal tool to do research. Upload untsructured data and develop insights.

UX Debugging. Used by the Product Team to watch replays of user sessions to identify exactly why a Broker abandoned the Create Listing flow or where the UI is confusing.  Conversion Intelligence. Tracks the Lost Revenue Funnel. It identifies exactly where paying customers drop off (e.g., Rage Clicks on the payment form) so Product teams can fix the revenue leak
Strategic Review / Build Plan (My Notes): Pricing scales too fast. Let's look at self-hosting PostHog (Open Source). It gives us the same session recording and analytics, but we keep the user data on our own servers and don't pay per-session.

Use Case: Marketing Asset Creation. Used by the Marketing Team to generate high-quality, animated MP4 charts for LinkedIn/Social Media to drive traffic to the platform (not used inside the app).
Backend Automation. The invisible framework developers use to orchestrate AI Agents that perform background tasks like scraping web listings or drafting email notifications.
Contact Unlocking. Powers the Reveal Decision Maker feature. When a Broker views a Stealth Tenant, this API fetches and displays the CEO/CFO's direct email and phone number.
Strategic Review / Build Plan (My Notes): We need to be aggressive about caching this. Once we unlock a CEO's email, save it in our DB forever. Eventually, we should build our own scraping harvester to build this database internally so we stop paying per-contact

Use Case: Product Intelligence Suite. It tracks User Behavior (what features Brokers use most), delivers In-App Guides (onboarding Landlords), and collects User Feedback. It is the brain that tells Product Management what to build next.
Strategic Review / Build Plan (My Notes): heavy 'All-in-One' suite. If we buy Pendo, we must use the Analytics deeply to justify the price. Strategic Pivot: Pendo can actually replace FullStory (session replay) and basic analytics. Decision: Either go 'All-in' on Pendo to consolidate tools, OR build a cheaper stack using PostHog (Analytics) + Driver.js (Guides).

Use Case: Dashboard Visualization. The UI component library that renders the interactive Market Heatmaps and Rent Growth Charts that Tenants and Landlords see on their home screens.
Strategic Review / Build Plan (My Notes): We need to own our visualization code. Let's use D3.js or Recharts. If we rely on Tako, we can't customize the Heatmaps exactly how we want. I want the 'Demand Heatmap' to be a proprietary asset we built.

Use Case: Natural Language Interface. The Ask an Analyst chat window where Enterprise users can type questions like Show me retail vacancy in Brickell and get an instant data answer.
Strategic Review / Build Plan (My Notes): This is great for the MVP, but long-term, we need to build our own Text-to-SQL agent using AI. We can't rely on a 3rd party to interpret our customers' questions about our data

Use Case: Self-Service Reports. A Report Builder tab for SaaS-tier Landlords, allowing them to drag-and-drop metrics to create their own custom portfolio performance views.
Strategic Review / Build Plan (My Notes): Way too expensive for general users. Reserve this strictly for the Enterprise tier. For everyone else, let's embed Apache Superset (Open Source) so they can do basic reporting for free.

Use Case: Risk Scoring Display. The engine that feeds the Tenant Success Probability percentage (e.g., 85%) displayed on a tenant's profile to help Landlords assess risk.
Financial Health Widget. Automatically fetches and embeds the latest 10-K/10-Q PDF filings on the profiles of publicly traded National Brand tenants for Landlord review.
Operator Validation. Displays a specific badge (e.g., Multi-Unit Operator) on a tenant profile so Landlords know if the applicant runs 1 store or 50 stores.
Trust Verification. Displays the BBB Accredited logo on Mom & Pop tenant profiles to validate their legitimacy and increase Landlord trust.
Subscription Mgmt. Processes monthly SaaS payments for Pro Tier access. (No rent collection)
Transaction Management. Allows users to legally sign LOIs and Leases inside the dashboard.
Security & Identity. Manages secure logins, Social Login, and Enterprise SSO.
Strategic Review / Build Plan (My Notes): Monitor the Monthly Active User count closely. If the bill jumps, we migrate to SuperTokens (Open Source). I don't want to pay a 'success tax' every time we sign up a new user.

Use Case: Identity Verification. Scans IDs to grant Verified Badges and prevent fraud.
In-App Communication. Powers real-time chat and Negotiation Rooms.
Strategic Review / Build Plan (My Notes): Expensive but hard to build well. Use for MVP. If we scale, switch to Socket.io and build our own chat server.

Use Case: Notification Engine. Delivers transactional emails like New Lead alerts.
Strategic Review / Build Plan (My Notes): Standard utility. Keep it. Building an email server from scratch is a deliverability nightmare.

Use Case: Location Intelligence & Isochrones. Beyond simple maps, it calculates Drive-Time Polygons (e.g., Show me all office space within a 20-min commute of this suburb). This is a critical search filter for corporate tenants.
Strategic Review / Build Plan (My Notes): Pay-per-load is risky. If we use the Isochrone API (Drive-time), Mapbox is worth the money because that math is hard to build. If we just use it for visual tiles, we should switch to MapLibre to save money.

Use Case: Automated Deal Extraction. The API that instantly reads uploaded Rent Rolls & LOIs, extracting fields (Rent, SQFT, Expiry) to auto-populate the listing form for the user. (Zero human intervention).
